page.title: 10WEST FELTON HOUSING
page.content: HOUSING IN WEST FELTON IS DIVIDED INTO COUNCIL HOUSING,ESTATE HOUSES AND PRIVATE HOUSES.THE TWO COUNCIL ESTATES ARE CALLED THE WHEATLANDS AND THE WILLOWS.THE WHEATLANDS CONSISTS OF SEMI-DETACHED HOUSES AND BUNGALOWS FOR ELDERLY PEOPLE.A FEW PEOPLE HAVE BOUGHT THEIR OWN HOUSE FROM THE COUNCIL.THE WILLOWS ALSO CONSISTS OF SEMI-DETACHED HOUSES AND OLD PEOPLES BUNGALOWS,BUT MOST OF THE HOUSES HAVE NOW BEEN BOUGHT BY THEIR OCCUPIERS,AND IMPROVED IN THEIR APPEARANCE. THERE ARE 2 ESTATES OF MODERN PRIVATE BUNGALOWS,THE AVENUE AND SPRINGFIELD GARDENS,AND A SMALL ESTATE OF DETACHED HIGH CLASS HOUSES IN STONE HOUSE DRIVE.THE REMAINDER IS A MIXTURE OF OLD STONE COTTAGES,A FEW LARGE HOUSES IN THEIR OWN GROUNDS AND PRE-WAR TRADITOINAL BRICK HOUSES.
